Netflix shares trade significantly higher than the levels they did before the company's last stock split in 2015 . Netflix expects double-digit revenue growth and significant operating margin expansion this year . The streaming giant's performance has been stellar. In the first quarter of 2025, revenue rose 12.5% year over year to about $10.5 billion .  Netflix's operating margin hit 31.7% in the first quarter, up from 28.1% . The company also reported free cash flow of $2.7 billion, up 25% year over year . Netflix hasn't split its shares since 2015, a 7-for-1 split lowered the company's share price .  Netflix shares currently trade far higher than other tech giants like Microsoft and Nvidia . A stock split would lower the price per share and make Netflix more accessible to retail investors . Splits are more likely when a stock becomes expensive and the company is on solid footing .  Netflix is a top contender for the next big tech stock split . Investors seem to be betting on more staggering growth from the streaming giant . Shares trade at 59 times earnings, a price-to-earnings multiple well in excess of Nvidia's .
